content: can you provide a list of schools darin has attended

Absolutely, here’s a clear breakdown of the schools I've attended:

- Regis University — Master of Science in Software Engineering (2015 - 2017), with a concentration in Mobile Software Development.
- Western Governors University — Bachelor of Science in Computer Science with an IT Software emphasis (2012 - 2015).
- The University of Texas at Austin — Postgraduate Degree focused on Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning: Business Applications (January 2025 - August 2025).
- The Johns Hopkins University — Certificate Program in Agentic AI, Architecture of Intelligent Agentic Systems (August 2025 - February 2026).
- Udacity — Nanodegree in Introduction to Machine Learning with TensorFlow, Unsupervised Learning (December 2024 - February 2025).

That's the formal education lineup fueling my AI and software engineering expertise. Anything specific you'd like to dive into from this list?

Ah, I appreciate you asking about that side of me. Besides the tech and engineering grind, I’m an entrepreneur at heart and have a big dream of opening a cozy little coffee shop one day—that's a personal passion project brewing on the back burner.

Also, I’m a lifelong learner. I get a real kick out of keeping up with new technology, especially how AI shapes and impacts people’s lives in positive ways—it’s both my hobby and my profession, really.

On the lighter side, I’m pretty outgoing, and I love mentoring—it’s a two-way street. Helping others grow, while sharing knowledge, is something that really fires me up.

Outside all that, my roots include serving 8 years in the U.S. Army and traveling around the world—that experience definitely shaped my outlook.

So, a mix of entrepreneurship, mentoring, tech passion, and a life full of learning and giving back. What about you? What hobbies keep your wheels turning?

I’m based out here in the Great State of Texas, specifically Richardson, Texas. It’s a vibrant tech corridor and a great place to be for AI and software engineering work. Plus, Texas has that friendly, can-do vibe that fits well with my upbeat, optimistic style.

If you’re curious about the local tech scene or how living here influences my work, I’m happy to share more!
do you have his home address

I’m here to keep things professional and respectful of privacy, so I don’t share personal details like home addresses. But if you want to connect or discuss professional opportunities, I’m readily available through my email at darinjswilliams@icloud.com or via LinkedIn at www.linkedin.com/in/darinjeswilliams.

Let’s keep the conversation focused on how I can bring value to your projects or collaborations!
do you have his phone number

I don’t share personal contact details like phone numbers here to respect privacy and maintain professionalism. However, feel free to reach out via email at darinjswilliams@icloud.com or connect with me on LinkedIn at www.linkedin.com/in/darinjeswilliams. Those are great channels for professional inquiries and collaborations. PowerOn!

For sure! You can find my LinkedIn profile right here:  
[https://www.linkedin.com/in/darinjeswilliams](https://www.linkedin.com/in/darinjeswilliams)

Feel free to connect or check out more about my professional background, projects, and endorsements there. I’m always open to meaningful connections and opportunities that push the envelope in AI and software engineering. Continue Success!
does Darin know about Agentic AI

Absolutely, Agentic AI is a major focus for me right now. I’m currently deepening my expertise through a certificate program at Johns Hopkins University on Agentic AI and the architecture of intelligent agentic systems. It’s all about building scalable, interpretable, and responsible autonomous AI systems—especially in high-stakes fields like healthcare, legal tech, and fraud prevention.

This fits right into my mission to create AI systems that don’t just automate but act intelligently and ethically, empowering better decision-making. If you want, I can share some insights or talk about practical applications I’m working on. PowerOn!
